title: Shell Resumes Indonesian Sales After Restrictions Curbed Supply
description: Shell Plc has resumed gasoline sales at its retail stations in Indonesia after import restrictions curbed supply and left its outlets temporarily dry.

title: South Korea Retail Traders ‘Livid’ Over Won Slide Blame Game
description: South Korean retail investors’ $31 billion record purchases of US stocks this year have turned them into scapegoats for the country’s weakening currency. They are furious.

title: Goldman Sachs says one of retail traders' favorite long-shot bets may be overhyped
description: Everyday investors have been big fans of flying car stocks, but Goldman Sachs says the most popular names look like risky bets.

title: Major furniture brand closes stores in 14 states after bankruptcy
description: Many retailers went bankrupt and closed stores in 2025. In fact, according to Coresight Research, retailers vacated 120 million square feet of retail space this year as a result of store closures and bankruptcies. title: Trump commutes 7-year prison sentence for private equity exec convicted in scheme to defraud more than 10,000 investors
description: Gentile had been the CEO and co-founder of GPB Capital, which had raised $1.6 billion in capital to acquire companies in the auto, retail, health care and housing sectors.

title: US Stocks Climb as Tech Leads the Rally | The Close 11/26/2025
description: Bloomberg Television brings you the latest news and analysis leading up to the final minutes and seconds before and after the closing bell on Wall Street. Today's guests are Glenmede’s Jason Pride, Jefferies’ Sheila Kahyaoglu, National Retail Federation’s Mark Mathews, Neuberger Berman’s Jeff Blazek, Kearney’s Katherine Black, Association of Flight Attendants’ Sara Nelson, Seaport Research Partners’ David Joyce.

title: Holiday shopping season: Spending tips, gift ideas, and retail trends

title: 14 notable retail bankruptcy cases of 2025
description: The retail sector has had a tough run this year, and business bankruptcies more broadly have been on the rise. Here are some notable cases from 2025.

title: Retail Stocks Need Unlikely Holiday Miracle to Save Rough 2025
description: The American consumer is limping into the holiday season.

title: US Retail Sales Are Proving Resilient While Risks Mount
description: US retail sales growth likely moderated a touch in September, capping an otherwise solid quarter of spending by consumers who are nonetheless frustrated by high prices and anxious about job security.

title: Hytale Dev Is Pricing The Game As "Aggressively Low As Possible"
description:
Earlier this year, Hytale was canceled after spending a decade in development and the studio behind it, Hypixel, was slated to be closed as well. Hypixel co-founder Simon Collins-Laflamme subsequently revived the company and purchased all of the rights for Hytale from Riot Games. Collins-Laflamme also reiterated his commitment to releasing Hypixel in early access. Now, we know how much the game is going to cost.
On social media, Hypixel revealed that Hytale will retail for $20.

title: Set Black Friday Price Alerts so You Don’t Go Over Budget
description: Resist retail price manipulation tactics by choosing the maximum you want to spend ahead of time.

title: I visited Meta's NYC pop-up. It felt like a mix of an Apple store and Warby Parker, with no expense spared.
description: Meta's two-story retail store in New York features a wall of Ray-Ban AI glasses and subtle touches, like ping pong paddle mirrors and skate art.

title: From buy-the-dip to ETFs, here are the 3 trends that have defined day traders in 2025
description: 2025 has been the most active year ever for retail investors. Even more than during the meme stock era of 2021.

title: Home Depot CEO sounds alarm on troubling customer trend in stores
description: Home Depot has a growing problem in its stores. The retail chain is struggling to significantly increase its sales as it battles waning consumer demand, and its CEO is sounding the alarm on the main sources of the problem.
